QUESTION:

TODAY'S DATE:
2024-12-12

RESOLUTION CRITERIA:
This question resolves as **Yes** if according to the [Forbes Real-Time Billionaires List](https://www.forbes.com/real-time-billionaires/#482980403d78) Michael Jordan has a higher net worth than Howard Schultz on December 31, 2024. Otherwise, this question resolves as **No**.

ADDITIONAL CRITERIA:
If there is a tie when looking at dollar values of their net worths, this resolves as **No**. If the resolution source is unavailable on December 31, 2024, resolution will wait until it is available (at which point it resolves based on the data shown), until January 3, 2025, at which point this question will be **annulled**. For more details on various edge cases regarding availability of or changes to the resolution source, please see Metaculus's ambiguity and annulment policies [here](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#ambiguous-annulled).  

BACKGROUND:
As of December 11, 2024, Michael Jordan's net worth was listed as $3.5 billion, according to Forbes, while Howard Schultz's net worth was $3.4 billion.

ADDITIONAL BACKGROUND:
To determine whether Michael Jordan's net worth will exceed that of Howard Schultz by December 31, 2024, here are the relevant details:

## Michael Jordan's Net Worth
As of 2024, Michael Jordan's net worth is estimated to be around $3.5 billion, primarily due to the sale of the Charlotte Hornets for $3 billion in June 2023, which significantly boosted his wealth[1][4].

## Howard Schultz's Net Worth
As of 2024, Howard Schultz's estimated net worth is at least $2.1 billion to $2.2 billion, primarily derived from his holdings in Starbucks Corp and other minor investments[2][5].

### Comparison
Given the current estimates:
- Michael Jordan's net worth is approximately $3.5 billion.
- Howard Schultz's net worth is approximately $2.1 billion to $2.2 billion.

### Conclusion
Based on the available information, Michael Jordan's net worth is already higher than Howard Schultz's net worth. Therefore, it is highly likely that Michael Jordan's net worth will exceed that of Howard Schultz on December 31, 2024, assuming there are no significant changes in their respective wealth in the remaining days of 2024.

This conclusion is clear and does not require speculation, as the current net worth values are well-documented and show a substantial difference in favor of Michael Jordan.
